intro: Backeria assamica, commonly known as the Assam backeria, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
